title: Sr Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Several 1:1 along with panel interviews. Interviews were structured but welcoming and positive team and interview experience overall. Description of the job and day-to-day were somewhat vague but that may be a result of the broad scope of the role.
Interview Questions: What is the one 'superpower' you bring to a team?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Kennesaw, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Was quick and didn’t take much time at all. Talked to all the providers that I would be working with and the job process was explained thoroughly. The process was easy
Interview Questions: Previous work experience and what if situations

title: Sr Consumer Voice Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the WellStar careers website on a Monday. By the next day, a recruiter reached out to schedule a screener. Did the screener a few days later, then was invited to a second interview with the hiring manager & another Sr Research Analyst. I felt that interview went extremely well, and I seemed to have a rapport with both people. Was invited to a third interview about 2 weeks later, and that was with 2 C-Level members of the Catalyst venture. Had the interview on a Monday, and it was very difficult. Received questions that had nothing to do with the job or role, but rather were to assess critical thinking. See some of the sample questions below. I definitely struggled and was outmatched in the third interview - it was not what expected, and it was impossible to prepare for. Found out yesterday (a day later) that I was not selected to move on. It's a shame because the role would have been prefect for me.
Interview Questions: Q: "We are going to give you a scenario. We've had feedback that our ER is overflowing with people. How would you go about redesigning an ER flow model to make it more efficient?"

title: Certified Nurse Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Fairly easy . The interviewer only asked questions pertaining to my medical background. She was nice and very attentive . I was told after the interview that I had a job
Interview Questions: Basic info about past work experience

title: RRT/RCP Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Austell, GA)
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. I was transferred due to closing of Wellstar AMC back in 2022. I had the option to choose another location, so I chose Austell as it is the closet to home.
Interview Questions: Transferred due to AMC closure

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty lengthy until I found a contact to help push my application forward. Be sure to find out who hiring manager is and send a brief email to express your interest.
Interview Questions: Can you handle high volume?

title: Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very good overall. The manager gave me all the details about the company and the job which was required of me. She also asked me about what would make me a great employee l
Interview Questions: How do I deal with conflict

title: Contracts Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy. Two interviews, the first one was better than the second. The first interview was with one person and the second one was with two or three people. Both interviews were ok, but I never heard back from them.
Interview Questions: Standard questions. They kept asking about volume.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very impersonal. You usually go through 2 short interviews. They asked about very basic questions, like where you live, how you commute, and what your availability is. One question they asked was what you think good healthcare is all about.
Interview Questions: My experience in the different place I have worked.

title: Cerified Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Birmingham, AL) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Very Smoot and simple. After your first interview they set you up with a second interview which is on a teams meeting panel style after that if they select you you’ll know in about 3-4 days.
Interview Questions: What purple color tube is used for

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: I waited in the waiting room for about 5-10 minutes and then was brought back to the manager's office. She went over my resume and asked me typical interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Wellstar? Why do you want to be a medical assistant? What are your strengths/weaknesses?

title: Strategy Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with recruiter that was very one-sided. It was basically a verbal application for the position where you simply confirmed the answers you had on your submitted application. This was followed up by an zoom interview with one of the VPs from the department.
Interview Questions: Tell me about how you've developed / executed long-term growth plans.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fair and fairly quick! Heard back the same week after one round of interviews. Also was able to negotiate, so new grads don’t be ashamed or afraid to negotiate!
Interview Questions: Tell me why you chose nursing? How would you describe or teach something to a patient ?

title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Two Zoom interviews, call with coworkers, wait on Talent Requisition. No call, found out I was not selected through their dashboard. The manager was very engaging and nice. Connected with one of the coworkers over the phone, the other sounded like she was in a hurry to get off of the phone. I miss in person connection.
Interview Questions: Would I be flexible to work in the other clinics offered

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Wasn’t good at all. Felt like the person interviewing me was rushing and wasn’t really paying attention to anything I was saying. Never putting another app in for wellstar ever
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work for wellstar

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Received an email initially stating that I was selected to be interviewed for the position. After I received the email I was then called and interviewed. I was asked basic interview question and then was told that I would receive a call back if they wanted to move forward.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was unlike anything I have ever experienced. There were 5 hiring managers, 3 floors or units represented. Each person took turns asking questions and then I was allotted time to ask questions. It was interesting process and I worked there for many years.
Interview Questions: Why did you become a nurse?

title: Front Office Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: In my opinion Fast, friendly, & efficient turn around time from the first interview to start date. Clear communication & expectations. Time between first interview to second interview happened pretty quickly.
Interview Questions: Are you a team player? What is customer service to you?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy and the office manager was very easy to speak with. I can honestly say I would apply again if I could. I think all office managers should take a small lesson from her.
Interview Questions: What are some good points about yourself?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Tour, clinical questions, contact the recruiter, spoke with them and they set up an interview, met team lead, received a call a week later. Overall it was a standard interview process Glad I got to work for them
Interview Questions: Clinical questions, scenarios, I was a new grad

title: Lab support Phlebotomist  Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Zoom style interview. A lot of questions about your experience as a Phlebotomist. Fast interview. Only lasted about 30 mins. I had three lab managers interviewing me. A bit overwhelming but manageable.
Interview Questions: Tube order of draw. Detailed blood culture collections.

title: Medical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not difficult. The professionals that I interviewed with were knowledgeable and friendly. They had great questions and it felt more like a conversation. It lasted less than 1 hour.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Explain how your experience fits with the position.

title: Patient Safety Sitter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was short direct and to the point. No intimidating question while also being very thorough. Everything was explained about the role and the culture and environment of the work place.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have relating to the offered position?

title: Ekg Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Austell, GA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was easy… wasn’t asked many questions… only went over the things on my resume and talked about the position. Gave me a tour of the unit, met everyone on the team. Acted as if I had the position during the interview and told me they would me calling me by next week once they get a actual start date situated and never heard back.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Have you ever used Epic?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Easy. Complete the personality questionnaire during the application process then wait to hear from a recruiter. The recruiter will do a phone screen and match either to the position you applied for or another available position they have. The final step is the interview with the hiring manager and/or team. If they decide to offer you the position, the recruiter reaches out with the offer letter within 1 week and if/when you accept, you get an onboarding team to walk you through the next steps.
Interview Questions: Relevant, recent experience and willingness to do the job.

title: Front Office Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: It Is A Timely Process Waiting To Onboard. But Recruitment Officials Are Nice. Over All It Seems Like A Really Great Place To Work. The Staff Was Kind Tge Supervisors I Met Were Very Helpful.
Interview Questions: Experience In The Field And Customer Custody Questions.

title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: The interview was virtual and very professional. I was very impressed by how organized wellstar was. The talent hr representative was in constant communication through phone and email to make sure my forms were completed.
Interview Questions: What is the reason you want to be a MA at wellstar.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: First step was a phone screen and then you were invited for a interview via webex. Interview consisted of “Tell me when” and why are you interested in the position. If hired, you would pick a day to come in and have a tour of the office.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you dealt with a difficult coworker and how did you handle it?

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Everythinh was Easy and very quick. He didn't ask very much, just about hours and told me a little about the job.After that  he talked about orientation. and how to being working
Interview Questions: Asked about my availability and if i has questions

title: Home Health Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Like any other process it was an in person interview and screening process that require you to share about yourself and how your experience can be used in the job
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Via zoom, pretty casual. I met or exceeded her requirements for the role. Even topics that she assumed I wouldn't be aware of, I explained that I had knowledge of and was currently gaining more experience. I was told I was be excellent for the role. I even went on to interview with the Director then same day.
Interview Questions:
What do you believe makes you qualified?
Have you ever had to deal with a difficult situation on your own?
Would you feel comfortable reprimanding an employee without assistance or supervision?

title: Principal Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty intuitive. As long as you are aware of your skill set you should be fine. The interview consisted of verifiable Epic Trainer and MST build skill requirements.
Interview Questions: Most difficult situation in MST build.

title: Student Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was really simple and easy. The interviewer just asked simple questions like why did choose nursing and which field do you want to work in future as a nurse.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to be a nurse?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: I interview with 3 managers on team’s. They asked alot of questions about customer service, interaction with patients.  They look for flexibility, they were super nice. Interview lasted about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Explain a time where a patient was up set about an issue with the company

title: Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application on careers.wellstar.org, and received a call from a Talent Acquisition Consultant (recruiter) who asked me about my qualifications, why I wanted to work at Wellstar, my availability, etc. She scheduled me for an interview to take place two days later. In the interview, I met with the unit's nurse manager, who asked me a few questions about my experience, how I handle situations, and more. After discussing the role and it's qualifications, we finished the interview. I received notice that I would be hired, got my offer letter the next day, and started about a week and a half later.
Interview Questions:
Q: How do you handle difficult interactions with patients?
Q: How do you think past experience will translate into this job?

title: Certified Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions:
Simple and easy. Asked the expected questions about scenarios.  I was able to get notified of the time and place (online program) in a timely manner so I could prepare. Everyone I encountered was kind and answered all the questions I had about the expected job tasks, work environment, salary and PTO questions. 
Enjoyed who they chose to interview me.
Interview Questions: What would you do in the situation if a nurse asked you to start an IV?

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: They emailed me with a time for a zoom interview. It was ~30 minutes and with the director. She told me about the hospital, how many therapists, etc. Then asked me a lot of questions.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult patients?

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions:
Many people involved - interviewed with 13 different people. More "get to know you" style interview and a good way to get a feel for the people and culture.
Did not interview with anyone that would eventually be on my team, which I think was a "miss" -
Interview Questions:
Why Wellstar?
Where would you begin to build out a strategy?

title: Senior Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Went through a recruiter but was still required to fill out an online application on WellStar's website. You can upload your resume for the application to parse it but it does a poor job of parsing it in the right chronological order. The online application makes it very unclear as to some values are not acceptable and some unrequired fields are required. They require 5 references.

This is just a precursor to how bad their interview process is. They expect candidates who can know languages as well as the creators of those languages.
Interview Questions:
What is the difference between Java and C#?
What is the difference between .Net  Core and .Net?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: I applied online after filling out the profile. Then I received a call from the recruiter to screen for qualifications. Once qualified I interviewed on the phone with the hiring manager. If you get past this stage, there is a face to face with hiring manger. Should the hiring manager move forward, then a team interview or panel interview with other managers. Once this is complete, then an offer is made.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this role?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Easy enough to do. Some phone call round some in person rounds and finally an offer or decline was made. I didn't get the position but it was an overall decent rxperience
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Front Office Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with a recruiter and she stayed with me until I got an offer and constantly reassured me she wouldn’t give up because there was a spot for me somewhere and we were going to fine it.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to work for wellstar?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Super easy & s t r a i g h t forward interview process. I didn't have any discrepancies. They got me in quick for the intrlerview, but the on boarding process was a little lengthy. It took a whole month to be official.
Interview Questions: What are the most common Immunization?

title: Digital Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: it was really long and I interviewed with a bunch of people who no longer work there, and then it was another few months before I was brought onto the company
Interview Questions: Can you develop in sitecore

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: It was very laid back. They just wanted to know the basics about you. It was an easy interview. I knew I had the job at the end of it.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict in the workplace?

title: Customer Service/Collections Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Absolutely terrible!!!!! The initial phone screening was ok she was very nice. However, the first interview was set for 11/9/21 at 2pm with Jessica McBride and Julia Jacob. I entered the Microsoft teams chat ready for my interview at 1:30 (if you’re early you’re on time) just for me to sit there until 2:16pm and no one ever showed up. 
I immediately send an email apologizing if there was something that I misunderstood or did wrong and got no email response.

 However, the next day someone calls me and sets me up for another interview with Ashley Smith on 11/12/21. I enter the Microsoft teams chat at 2:33pm ready for my 3:00pm interview; no one shows up…again!! So I email Ted Lebeau right away letting them know about the inconvenience and that this was my 2nd time not only showing up early, but being stood up for yet another interview in the same week all by different people! 

To add icing on the cake, I get a random email after not hearing back from anyone, to fill out my references as a part of the hiring process. So I did that all in a time span of 24-48hours. I follow up with Ted Lebeau again after completing my references just to be ignored and tossed aside like I was through this entire interview process. 

For someone that actually goes to Wellstar and admired their customer service whenever I do go, this was absolutely the worst interview experience I’ve ever encountered. The lack of communication and professionalism displayed from this team is utterly disgusting and unacceptable. Definitely would not recommend.
Interview Questions: There were no questions asked because no one ever showed up to the interview.

title: Trauma Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: 1st interview with recruiter, next interviewed with the Director and final interview was a team interview (panel style) I was asked STAR questions by different members of the team. The overall interview process was very comfortable.
Interview Questions: Name a time type questions.

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The overall hiring process was really quick and to the point…I applied on a Sunday, got a callback on Monday and had an interview and offer on Tuesday. The position details were clearly explained as far as scheduling and pay.
Interview Questions: Was I comfortable dealing with COVID positive patients?

title: Not Applicable Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by two Supervisors. Both were very nice and supportive. Wanted to explain a lot about their views and company changes. Explained that the position I was applying for was more of an administrative position rather than a hands-on position.
Interview Questions: How did I handle a difficult situation in the past or How would I handle a difficult situation if faced with one?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Multiple mix ups from the HR. After 4 interviews there was zero communication for several weeks. Not able to reach anyone in that department via phone or email. Very little transparency during the process. After all that, they was sent a generic e-mail saying I was not chosen. No details as to even what position they were referring to in that e-mail.
Interview Questions: How you handle working with difficult people?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fair and I was given  a lot of information about the position during the interview. I was encouraged  to ask lots of questions and my questions were answered. The recruiter was very informative about the interview process and communicated what to expect. I thought the interview process was fairly smooth.
Interview Questions: When was a time you experience a conflict with another staff member and how did you handle the situation?

title: Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Many interviews over a span of a couple of weeks. Poor contact  with Human  resources. Range not listed in job description. All this effort and time to find they can’t pay me what I want! Very frustrating experience.
Interview Questions: What attracted you to this position?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Their process moves along quickly. Not intimidating at all. I interviewed with AVP and VP and they were very straight forward in their needs. I would enjoy working for either anytime.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work for Wellstar?

title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Do you work better independently or as part of a team? How would your friends and/or coworkers describe you in three words?. What’s one skill you have that sets you apart from other candidates for this job?
Interview Questions: why do you want this job.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Woodstock, GA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by Jason, a Talent Acquisition Consultant- he was very polite, professoinal, informative, and helpful in setting up my interveiw with Michelle the manager of the department I was interviewing for. The interview went great, I could tell from the beginning that she knew and loved her job, wanted to help make sure all parties involved were a good match for each other, and was extremly polite and professional. I knew WellStar and Michelle was who I wanted to work for! After I was offered the position, Jason stayed in contact, and went above and beyound to get all things squared away for me to make the deadline to be in the very next next round of employee orientation.
Interview Questions: Tell about an instance where I had to collaborate with co-workers at a previous job.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: There is a phone interview with the recruiter, a Gallup survey and then the final interview. It was an easy process to navigate. They did not ask many questions. None were trick questions.
Interview Questions: What made you decide to get into this speciality?

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was quick. Applied online, heard something back from HR next day. HR contacted me and asked basic questions regarding my application. Then scheduled an interview with nurse manager. That interview lasted about 15 mins, asking behavior questions.
Interview Questions:
When was a time you had to make a quick decision and what was the outcome? 

Have you ever disagreed with your manager? How did you handle that?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Everyone i spoke to during the interview was very pleasant and made me want to be part of their team. The hiring recruiter was also very nice. Everyone answered the questions I had and extended the offer to reach out if I had more questions.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2021

Interview Questions:
The basic interview questions. 
Tell me about yourself. 
Why should he choose you. 
Do you have a problem asking ask sick people for money. 
How do you deal with stress. 
How do you deal with working with different personalities.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: everyone was very kind, but the interviewing process was a bit short. However, they did give us enough time to talk about ourselves, and I was able to talk to the nursing managers.
Interview Questions: tell me about a time...

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Pretty cool, usual questions like what do you bring to this organization? What would you do in a conflict with a coworker. How would you handle stressful situations? Interviewed with one person.
Interview Questions: Pretty cool, usual questions like what do you bring to this organization? What would you do in a conflict with a coworker. How would you handle stressful situations? Interviewed with one person.

title: Digital Performance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Filled out an application online on the Wellstar site and was sent an assessment, which I completed the next day, then the recruiter called to setup a phone screen two days later. Phone screen was pretty standard and non technical. I told them I was about 10 days further in the process with some other companies (which I was) but was very interested in this position, so if we could compress the timeline, that would be awesome! Spoke to the hiring manager for an hour, who was a really smart guy and someone I would have got along with very well it seems. About a week later I spoke with the VP for an hour, who I was flattered took the time to interview me even though she was on vacation that week. I notified them I had another offer but I was certainly interested in discussions if they wanted to make one as well. That was the last I heard from them. There were some concerning answers to some of the questions I had about the department strategy and makeup, so it was probably a good pass for all parties. 

HR Pros, please make sure you don't leave your candidates twisting in the wind. Most of us understand that at the 10-14 day mark you've passed but if you do a phone screen, at least send out an e-mail to say "thanks but no thanks."
Interview Questions: What is your favorite ad campaign running right now?

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Unprofessional, I felt that they only wanted a certain type in the organization. They had their mind made up before the interview. I hope upper management and HR take a look into hiring practices.
Interview Questions: Not many questions asked. They already had in mind what they wanted.

title: RN New Grad Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very smooth! After you apply to their residency program, they will send you an email and a text for you to sign up for an interview time. They used sign-up genius for our convenience and they also contact you even if you don't get the job.

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward! I was so nervous but the interviewer was nice and didn’t come off as intimidating so that helped me relax a bit. I was sent an offer the following week.
Interview Questions:
Explain why teamwork is so important. 
Why wellstar?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very quick. I interviewed via the virtual job fair on a Saturday and heard back with an off by the following Wednesday . Since then I have received my Orientation start date and the required information I need to complete prior to attending orientation
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you experienced conflict and how did you handle it?

title: Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Pretty simple. One quick interview with a recruiter. “This is the position, this is the schedule, these are the requirements. Does that work for you?” And then another interview with the nurse manager.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to handle a difficult situation.

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2021

title: Pre-boarding Coordinator Interview

That recruiter scheduled me for an interview with the managers but never made the effort to call me to explain the position details, compensation, interview process, etc. I made it to final interviews with the team and never heard from my recruiter after that. I understand recruiters are busy but the lack of communication and inability to close the loop with a candidate put a very poor taste in my mouth.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a mistake you made in the workplace and what you learned from it.

title: MRI Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I am currently in the process of relocating to GA. I had an interview on a Monday. I flew to GA specifically for the interview. I was told I would interview with the supervisor but when I arrived 15 minutes early I was told he wasn’t available and I would do a peer interview instead. I was put in a clustered room with a chief tech and peer. They didn’t have my resume nor did they seem prepared. They printed off the peer interview questions and that was it. I was showed around the department and then left. Interview was 22mins. Very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Tell me why we should give you the job over other candidates?

title: Clinical Nurse Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions:
HR was friendly and professional. However my interview with the hiring manager was one of the strangest experience I've had and would keep me from seeking care at the facility.

The hiring manager was 30 minutes late to the interview. I'm using the word interview lightly. She literally did not ask me one question throughout the one hour I was there. No "tell me about yourself," no "what interests you about the position," nothing.

They were hiring a nurse manager for a new clinic they were opening. Without coming up for air,  hiring manager told me about the clinic and position. Sensing she was not going to ask me any questions, I occasionally tried to interject to highlight my experience or ask thoughtful questions about the role and how I might contribute to the mission of starting a new clinic.

She did answered my questions in a superficial manner that, to me, indicated they were ill-prepared to open a clinic and might not even understand the role of a nurse manager. She never asked a follow up question. Really weird.

A few weeks later, I got an email from HR saying they had decided to move forward with other candidates. I could do anything but laugh because I have no idea how they could possibly decide between candidates when the hiring manager is such an incompetent interviewer.
Interview Questions: I was not asked and questions.

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was horrible! Very discouraged once I spoke with the recruiter. I received what I thought was a spam email, after researching the domain name I found that it was in fact sent from the hiring manager. I responded with my times available. Interview went great from what I perceived. The hiring manager seemed interested and asked that I contact her directly if I had any questions. I then received a call from the recruiter asking for my references. 2 hiring managers were REQUIRED and 3 remaining were normal business references. I found this to be quite difficult as my previous managers were no longer with my old employment I was fortunate enough to have a great rapport with a few old colleagues and was able to gain contact. 
Once completed I insisted on following up to get more information on what to expect, however when I spoke with the recruiter she just told me that they are still reviewing at that time. What caught me by surprise is when she asked about my expected salary range. When I confirmed she replied "oh they are not going to pay you that much for this position!" I was highly offended by this especially after doing my research and my 8 years of experience it was reasonable. I asked if she could tell me what the projected salary would be? She stated that the compensation department would review and provide she wouldn't know. At this point I truly was no longer enthused. After the call I heard nothing from both the manager or recruiter for almost 3 1/2 weeks.
 I sent a follow up email to both and received out of office replies. After another weekend had passed, I then received a call from the recruiter stating that she had received my email and that I was still a finalist and that she was waiting to hear back from the hiring manager. The next day I received an email stating that I was no longer a finalist for the position. What a waste of time! Recruiters should follow up with candidates as they expect us to follow-up with them! Simple...
Interview Questions: how would you handle multiple tasks a day, where you would have to follow up with providers, you may also have to drive on site to assist, also respond to emails..etc.

title: Staff RN Interview

Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was called back two days later. I had a phone interview and never heard back from wellstar. I had to call the recruiter to find out if an offer was extended or not.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Very lengthy with a lot of background checks. Very professional. It lasted about a week. I had to get a drug test and wait for those results. It helped that I knew someone in a supervisory position at Wellstar and it helps to know an employee so they can vouch for you.
Interview Questions: Who referred you to this company?

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on March 14 and took the Gallup assessment on March 16, 2018. A recruiter called to schedule an interview with me, the interview took place on April 30. Five references were asked to review my nursing skills which was completed last week. I am waiting on the next step.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with a critical patient?

title: Kitchen Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview for fifteen minutes, than second face to face interview. Meet people. They ask questions about previous job. Why did you pick this job. Expectations for new job, staff and team.
Interview Questions: What is your current salary.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met with a panel of three. they asked questions ranging from my background up to why i wanted the position. this came after having a personality test done online. After making it to this level, i was then called in for a panel review
Interview Questions: Was I interested in full time or part time work

title: Environmental Services Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: It wasn't long at all, however I felt like it was rushed. I felt it was rushed because the manager kept getting interrupted by calls, and so we didn't really get to talk much. He was nice, and gave me a date and time to observe. Also he was nice, because even though I didn't have my resume with me, he still gave me a chance to observe.
Interview Questions: Have you had any experience with housekeeping?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Job transfer then got a phone call, then set up interview.. hr took 3 days just to call me in to set an appointment to see the hiring manager
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you want to work for the company

title: Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (New York, NY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Great 3 different people ask questions...
Really all questions were frank and to the point. They ask a lot of questions related to the job that you applying to. So you have to be on point with your answers
Interview Questions: Give me a time when?

title: Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Had to call them to find out the outcome. The reason for not getting the job was not true. This left a negative impression on the company. You must pass the personality/IQ assessment to be considered.
Interview Questions: Asked  behavior based questions.

title: Senior Manager Recruiting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The Recruiter left a vm, never followed up,  I left several,vm, two weeks later they claimed had a personal issue and would call me next week, then never followed up.  I left vm with the HR VP, TA VP, HR managers, HR admin.  No one responded, apologized, followed up.  Worst and rudest experience ever.  And I was interviewing to the the recruiting manager!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Front Office Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Roswell, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Several interviews, all give you the impression they are interested, go back into the profile and it shows interviewed, not selected. It's very irritating and I will not go on anymore interviews with Wellstar. I guess it's true gotta know someone to get in. I've been well qualified at all interviews, easy questions and to the point. Very disappointing. I'm still being contacted very from different offices.
Interview Questions: Describe myself!

title: Family Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was screened out after 5 minutes for having less than 1 year of experience, but my resume clearly stated I was a new graduate. They did not take into account how much other experience I had before my FNP degree, such as RN experience or previous work experience applicable to the position including FNP rotations.
Interview Questions: 1. How many years of experience do you have?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Austell, GA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: My interview was Ridiculous...the hiring process is unbelievable rigid and when you're on board all you find yourself surrounded with is  ...incompetent...judgmental...condescending...arrogant...shallow...superficial,unqualified,  scandalous,did I mention ridiculous  people.
Interview Questions: Where did I last work

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Roswell, GA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: the interview was 30-45 minutes long, they stated what they were looking for, asked about previous experience and how I can contribute to the role. I was interviewed by 2 people at one time. I got a tour around all 3 units and was told HR would contact me if I was chosen. HR contacted me about 2 weeks later
Interview Questions: what previous experience do you have in healthcare

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Leadership and informal peer interviews.  There were no behavioral interview questions. There were no job duty specific questions.   It was a slow process. Even though there were vacancies and apparently qualified applicants, it didn’t seem like hiring was a priority. I almost accepted another offer only because the hiring process was so slow.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very laid back. There were two people in the interview who took turns asking a set of question, most of which related to patient care from clinicals. The questions were simple and mostly focused on customer satisfaction, problem solving, and conflict management in which you would than give examples from past experience. They manager does ask for your top 3 choices once you graduate and get ready for nursing, and is looking for externs who would want to be retained within WellStar.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time where you provided excellent customer service.

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process what very easy. I first applied online and was contacted by the hiring staff to complete a talent acquisition and personality quiz online. After completing those I was contact by the office manager and asked to come in for a one on one interview. It was very personable and I did not feel uncomfortable or nervous about it. I was offered the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: Why did you decide to choose to apply to Wellstar?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Not difficult at all. I applied online and received a call back three days later. The phone interview was pretty routine and not difficult.  The interviewers asked basic questions and seemed interested in my replies.
Interview Questions: Describe a time that you made a mistake.

title: Travel Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: very friendly, open discussion about the career aspects. talk about how to handle the conflict on the unit and patients. How to take care of difficult patients and patient's family members.
Interview Questions: How do you manage the difficult patients?

title: Mobility Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Douglasville, GA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very short straight forward interview. Lasted around 15 mins. Asked a lot of questions about who I am and future plans. Went over the job description very thoroughly. Asked about my volunteer work
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter with WellStar had reached out to me  via email (and left me a voice message) to set up an over-the-phone interview. I responded within the hour with a couple of days and times that were good for me. The recruiter then sent me a meeting notice for one of the dates/times I had mentioned, and said she would call me and confirmed my phone number. The day and time of the interview came and went without the recruiter having called me. I sent the recruiter an email inquiring if I had confused the date/time, and I also left a voice message for this person. At first I chalked it up to a mix-up in dates/time, or that the recruiter was out sick (or had an emergency.) To date, I've not had a follow-up phone call or email explaining the missed interview. I'm wondering if this is any indication of the type of organization they are. Very disappointing in the lack of common courtesy.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the New Grad Residency Program 8/04/2017. I received a phone call on 8/07/2017 to schedule an interview. I interviewed on 8/11/2017 and received an offer that same day. The interview consisted of 3 cardiac unit managers from different locations and one lady that facilitated the interview. It was a laid back environment, we sat around a big square table. You need to bring 5 copies of your resume (I printed mine out on resume paper and they appreciated it) and have questions for the interviewers prepared. The questions they asked were pretty basic, and they want you to pull from your clinical experience. They also give you nursing diagnoses to choose from and ask you what treatment would you expect to be ordered. By the time my interview was over, I had all 3 managers ready to offer me a position.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose nursing?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: I am absolutely appalled and disgusted by this company. On the day of the phone interview, the recruiter called me an hour after the scheduled time. The actual interview went very well, and I was offered several positions about a week later. I was incredibly excited and called the recruiter back the same day to accept a position. After 2 weeks, I hadn't heard back from Wellstar about the offer letter or paperwork. I decided to call them a few times to see what was going on. Since nobody would pick up the phone, I left a polite message inquiring about the status of my offer. Two more weeks go by and still nothing, not even a call back. This morning, I called them back again and FINALLY the recruiter picked up the phone. When I asked what happened to my "offer", she had the nerve to tell me that the positions that I accepted were actually not available and that I may be able to work at another hospital. HOW ON EARTH do you offer someone a job that does not exist. HOW?! And WHY?! couldn't they have the decency to tell me what happened?! This is the most unprofessional experience I have ever had in my life.
Interview Questions: How would you treat a patient with renal failure

title: Insurance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Lagrange, GA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was emailed by management and asked to come in for an interview. During that time discussed my experience and was told about the company and the job itself, was told they would be in touch and heard back a few weeks later, was sent for drug screen and started two weeks after that, orientation was at the hospital and was sent to atlanta for emr training
Interview Questions: They asked my experience.

title: Staffing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Just you're typical interview. Asked the same general questions. Took about 30 minutes. Overall it was a great interview, learned about the position. Was told there is lots of room for growth.
Interview Questions: Explain a time where you had to be a assertive

title: PSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from someone in Hr asking me to come in for an interview 2 days later. She didn't give her name and she spoke really fast lol. I got to my interview, and met the supervisor and manager who seemed pretty nice. Then the manager took me on a tour like others have said. The interview was short, so it wasn't much of an interview to me. They were interviewing A LOT of ppl for one position, so I think they already had someone in mind by the time my interview came around.
Interview Questions: How's your flexibility with the schedule?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was simple. Basic questions. I was told things about the job that wasn't really true. I was told there would be opportunities for overtime and there isn't. I applied for the night shift and I ended up on days to be an "assistant" to the nurse manager.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for WellStar?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Austell, GA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Five panel interview with directors  of different departments. Everyone was friendly and welcoming. Total process took 20-25 minutes.  Asked multiple questions relating to patient access and customer service.  Talked about advancement opportunities.
Interview Questions: Strengths and weaknesses

title: Talent Acquisition Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I filled the application out online and I say within a week I got a call for to come in for an interview. It has been about three weeks and I haven't heard anything, so I guess I didn't get it. Oh yeah, It was for an internship. The talent Acquisition Manager was nice and it seemed like I might have been a shoe in, but I guess I read that wrong.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got a call back from a recruiter.  Not a lot of information was given however I was told that it would be a group or panel interview with multiple departments. They asked a lot of med surg questions in my interview.  I was a little thrown off honestly but if you can maintain yourself you will likely receive an offer.
Interview Questions: Talk about a patient from clinical... and then they ask specific questions about the patient based on your answer

title: Medication History Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Lagrange, GA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: The face to face interview was pleasant but the pre hire process was a nightmare.  You get a call back telling you that you are hired on contingency, in other words don't put in your two week notice. I was also asked some very personal question from a public records profile online. Not an official background check simply invalid, unverifiable, false, misleading public records. Google or people finder.
Interview Questions: How do you react to working with difficult coworkers? Please give us a specific example of how you worked through the situation.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Lagrange, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online several times and was contacted about a month later by phone. I was asked to come in for a interview scheduled approx. a month after that with management. After this I had a peer interview with nurses who already worked in the particular unit I had applied for. I was contacted by phone about a week later and sent an official offer letter shortly after.
Interview Questions: 3 best and 3 worst qualities. a time you showed leadership. most difficult decision you have ever had to make.

title: Retail Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Austell, GA)
Interview Descriptions: I received my initial email to meet with the Talent Acquisition Manager, during which we discussed the job, the pay, etc etc...We then went to the Dept and I interviewed with the Manager​ and Assistant Manager. Following that I received a contingency offer of employment, pending drug and background check. It is imperative​ that you move quickly, as you can end up waiting 30 days to start if you miss orientation.
Interview Questions: What kind of management style do I have, and how do I prefer to managed.

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was rather rigorous, but worth it if you have an ambition to work in a Wellstar hospital. Initially, my interview was in person with 2 nurses (a nurse manager and staff RN). I did not feel overwhelmed or nervous in the interview because of their welcoming demeanor and the style of questions that were asked. I was able to be myself and provide real, honest answers as if I was having a conversation with colleagues.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Social Media Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: They got right to the point. The interviewer was very direct, had done his research on me and asked good, insightful questions. He was very enthusiastic about the organization and his team.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I knew HTML coding.

title: Surgical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. I submitted an application online. one week later I received an email from the recruiter after I submitted my application. I actually thought that my application will not be considered but I am glad it was. The recruiter had a few general questions with me. She then told me I will hear back for the next step.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working at WellStar Health System?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was fairly standard. Was asked about experience and why would I want the job. Questions like how do I react in certain situations and was asked about my future career goals. I interviewed with the doctor and hiring manager. And they both asked me questions about myself and why did I choose the medical field. Those types of standard questions. They definitely wanted to know my skill level and if I was able to do certain medical field related things.
Interview Questions: Why did I choose the medical field?

title: Project Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was average. Never heard back from recruiter after interview in spite of several follow up attempts. Received a generic email 4 months after the interview saying I didn't get the job. You can tell a lot by a company's culture with how they treat job applicants during the interview as well as after the interview. Not good at all!
Interview Questions: What are your project management skills?

title: Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the nurse residency program via WellStar Careers site. I received a call about 2 weeks later for an interview. The feedback was quick. I made sure to submit all proper documentation and references in a timely manner.
Interview Questions: Chose a patient scenario (stroke, respiratory acidosis, seizure, or sepsis) and tell me how you will treat this patient?

title: Med Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview had a few job related questions and a great number of behavioral questions. The conversation was very pleasant and to the point. The Human Resource person was helpful and professional as well. Very good experience overall.
Interview Questions: Think of a case when you are under lots of stress.

title: Lifestyle Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: went to office to interview. they asked typical interview questions. very friendly staff! lasted 30 minutes. I got a call back pretty quickly. good questions asked (strengths/ weaknesses) what would you do under stress...
Interview Questions: list strengths and weaknesses

title: Clinical Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: My interview process with Wellstar was like a rollercoaster. I applied to about 10 different positions for Cobb General and Kennestone . I never received a callback until I submitted a cover letter and instantly I receive 4 interviews . Every one of them was a different experiences . I had two at Cobb General and two at Kennestone. I was contacted by HR and was prompted to fill out a professional reference form . Its important to fill this out or you won't be offer the job . All the interviews were panel interviews with the lead nurse in charge and sometimes other Care partners . All of the interviews was more than 30 mins long and I was ask a series of general question . 3/4 of the interviews were a positive experience. The other one I felt very discourage after I left . The Manager was rude and had a attitude . My advice is always become prepared and do some research prior to interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Easy but all lies, it was a group interview the people were nice but they feed you a bunch of lies they over work there staff and the pay is horrible!!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The Interview was with shift supervisor & security director. They were o.k. but came to the interview late. We performed the interview in the security office and they asked several questions pertaining to the position and explained the position in depth.
Interview Questions: Level of experience, jobs worked, tell a little about yourself, etc.

title: Central Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Very light and easy going
Questions were to the point 
Human Resources was very helpful 
Hiring process kinda long
The overall experience was kinda long but through
I was offered the job 
This is a good entry level position to build upon
Interview Questions: How long do you expect to work for WellStar and why?

title: Care Partner & Emergency Department Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for several care partner positions in  Dec.2016 at 2 Wellstar locations. I got 2 emails inviting me for interviews in less than a week. I was interviewed by 4 nurse managers at 1 location who were quite nice and personable. Then 3 managers at the other location; they were nice enough. From my application process to interviews to finally getting 3 job offers, it all took about 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Wellstar?

title: Imaging Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: It took several phone calls and follow up to get an interview scheduled. Very awkward. Not much in the way of preperation either. Told it would be two people interviewing me and got their to find four people. Imagine my surprise.
Interview Questions: What was my weakness?

title: Unit Support Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied one day then the next I got a call about an interview. The interview went great they were super nice! They told me what shifts I might would be working, and talked to me about training. The next day I got a call about an offer.
Interview Questions: What is one thing your afraid of while transporting a patient?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview wasn't in my opinion an interview. At least it didn't seem like such. The atmosphere was laid back. I was interviewed by a supervisor and manager of the department. They both seemed happy to work at Wellstar. Interview was very smooth. I was interviewed in October 2016 and got an offer December 2016.
Interview Questions: How long I have been in nursing?

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and to the point. I met with the head of the Medical Dept and the Nurse Manager. They asked the standard questions about my background. They asked me what I would do in certain scenarios. They gave me a description of a typical day and asked how I would like it.
Interview Questions: If you have various tasks to complete before your shift ends, would you do all of your work quickly and be done, or would you space of the assignments over the duration of your shift?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Cobb, GA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The waiting game was definitely the hardest part. It took a while for HR to pull my application. Once I was called to interview it was a round  table interview with several nurses that work on the floor. We met in an open room on the floor and discussed several patient/staff scenarios.
Interview Questions: What would I do if there was confrontation with another employee?

title: Nutrition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Austell, GA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was just simple answers, See if you're availability was good, and to see if you have any records on you. Later on they'll ask you for a drug test and thats about it.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience in this job.

title: Purchasing and Receiving Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from HR for a phone interview then face to face interview.  Interview was easy and simple.  More of a conversation than a STAR method interview.  He didn't tell me I would be going in the freezer to do a job.  I wish he was upfront with me on that.  But I was desperate and needed a job.  I got a call with an offer took it because HR said they give out great raises.  She was lying. Been here 6 months only got a .10 raise.
Interview Questions: Are you a hard worker?

title: Rehab Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Kennesaw, GA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted for an interview 2 weeks later. Simple interview. Lasted about 15 minutes with the Clinic Director. It was very laid back and professional. I wish I could of received an email saying the position was filled.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Kennesaw, GA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Amazing! Took awhile to get through HR though. Had to have a friend who was already employed give a referral. Manager very knowledgeable and pleasant. Received phone call with job offer otw home
Interview Questions: Clinical scenarios, why Wellstar, etc

title: Clinical Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Very professional. All the people that took the time to interview me were passionate about the Wellstar system. I first talked to a representative in HR, and she did an excellent job giving me a review of the interview process, and the job details. She then walked me over to the interviewers. It was a group panel, and they asked me about my experience, and why I wanted to work for Wellstar specifically. I really enjoyed the interview with them.
Interview Questions: What are your experience?

title: Rrt Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 people during the interview. 2 were not attentive. Their phones kept ringing and disturbing the interview. They really didn't know what type of questions to ask me. It was about a 20 minute interview. I think it could have been better.
Interview Questions: what did I know about wellstar

title: Environmental Service Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied on Wellstar website. Had a quick phone interview where she asked my availability and then invited me to come in for an interview. It was a panel interview with the director, hiring manager, and team leader.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you gave excellent customer service.

title: Clinical Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I first met with an HR Recruiter after posting a online application. She called exactly 10 minutes after I sent my resume' through Wellstar.org!  She then sent me emails with the things I needed to finish such as the assessment and scheduled a interview for two days later! She was so nice and helpful we started to talk like old friends! She then took me down to meet with three other department heads and manager in a board room format, I was asked several question by two and one looked like he was totally lost! But I enjoyed talking with the two ladies and they were informative and kind!
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to deal with a difficult patient?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I walked into the facility from an interview directly across the street in a private Dr. office and was able to speak with a hiring manager on the spot.  The talent counselor called the Head Nurse for an on spot interview and I was able to ask all the questions and get the details on the new renovations happening at the North Fulton Hospital facility in the near future.
Interview Questions: I looked to polish for the position.  How would I feel about cleaning feces from sick people?

title: Registered Nurse (RN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was unprofessional.  I was engaged by a recruiter and treated fairly well In the beginning. During the interview the leaders were not prepared and unorganized. Following my interview it took over a week a year back recruiter or the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: I was not asked that many questions.  Instead I was told more about the program.

title: Front Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my resume online, I was called for a telephone interview. This was followed by a call to set up a face to face interview. Interview lasted approximately 30 minutes. After interview I was contacted by a Talent Acquisition Specialist by email to submit my references online and to provide information and approval for a background check. Once these were completed, I was telephoned within 12 hours and offered a job position.
Interview Questions: They simply asked me about my previous position and why I had left and asked if I had any questions and then we simply chatted about these things. Very easy interview. Were very focused on whether I would be a good fit for their office and that I had the proper experience.

title: Medical Laboratory Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with both the Laboratory Director and the Laboratory Manager. The interview was easy going and comfortable.   They asked about previous jobs positions and my ability to do routine task as a Medical Laboratory Technician.
Interview Questions: What made you choose to work at Wellstar Health System.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I came to one of the open interview days with HR. They asked me what unit I was interested in and then called up to the floor for me to meet with the nurse manager of the unit. On the floor, they showed me around and the process was more of getting to know me than a formal interview. This was a Thursday. She let me know the next step was shadowing, which I did on Monday night. And I got the offer Friday morning.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your last position?

title: Registration Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process didn't take long. I interviewed with one manager during a job fair. Then a week or 2 later I got a call for another interview with another manager. Then after a couple of weeks I got offered the position. I went through the process of background and reference checks, drug screening etc. The had orientation that told me what I needed to know.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with the VP of Compensation and was offered the job a couple of days later. There were several people in the lobby waiting to meet with her so that was rewarding to speak to some of them. The interview took about 25 mins and she was very passionate about her job which made me want to work there even more.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Austell, GA) in May 2016
