Interview Descriptions: Interviewed in a panel setting, everyone was very nice and welcoming. Everyone seemed very down to earth and understanding of weaknesses and have a training period to assess that and work with you to improve that area. For a new graduate, that meant a lot! They explained the interview process and job requirements up front. Everyone took turns asking questions. Very smooth and professional interview!
Interview Questions: Typical interview questions, What are your strengths/weaknesses/qualities that stand out above the rest, etc.

title: RN Staff Nurse, Labor & Delivery Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Griffin, GA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very informal and comfortable. Met with the department manager, who was a delight, and just discussed the position that was available. They were pretty quick to get back to me with an offer, but unfortunately their offer wasn't anywhere close to the salary I have been making. They were unwilling to negotiate, I kind of felt they did not want to pay for my experiences and knew they could hire a new nurse for a much lower price. Very sad as I loved meeting with the manager and I saw myself bringing a new future to the department as it grew under its new name of Wellstar Spalding.
Interview Questions: Why I applied for the position?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very brief. Asked a few questions about my background and experience and told me a little about the company.  I had a feeling i didn't have the experience they were looking for. I plan on reapplying. They are a great company to work for from what I have heard
Interview Questions: How much experience i have

title: New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Completed online profile and application received call for interview within 2 weeks or so. It was a panel. Interview consisted of many nurse managers from different hospitals with a teleconference included.
Interview Questions: Why wellstar

title: Account Resolution Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Long and lengthy process so do not expect an call back quickly. And be prepared to know about the position you apply for. Go in confidence and be very approachable
Interview Questions: What do you know about AR?

title: Registered Nurse (RN) Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Everyone in the front office was very friendly. They made me feel much more relaxed before I went in for my interview. I interviewed with five different nurse managers. They were all very relaxed and made it a very comfortable interview.
Interview Questions: One time you had a disagreement with an employee and how did you handle it

title: BI Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions:
1st call by the HR- asked about my background, walk through of my resume, 3 strengths and weaknesses. what is difference between where clause and having clause. what is SELECT in SQL. different parts of a SELECT statement.Differences between Tableau and Qlikview. 
2nd call is in person interview- Asked about normalization, full join and UNION,how to create dashboards in tableau, what are the difficulties in tableau. compare and contrast Tableau,Qlikview and SSRS.
Interview Questions: Describe about a difficult situation you had with your co-worker

title: Clinical Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Austell, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied about 20 times before getting a callback. Interview was with a panel of about 7 nurse managers. Fairly easy and informal. Simple and quick process after interview. I don't have anything else to say but I have a 50 word minim quota to reach
Interview Questions: The usual scenario about handling an angry customer

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It's a panel style interview heald at the WellStar Development Center. My panel consisted of the head of the residency program, a clinical nurse educator, and the assistant nurse manager of the unit to which I would be hired.
Interview Questions: Explain a time you provided excellent customer service.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (North Atlanta, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application via website and was required to complete online personality assessment (like Myers-Briggs). Telephone interview, then F2F interview. Personality assessment took a while- plan on being in a quiet environment and stay focused. Streamline process that was timely.
Interview Questions: How do you handle demanding clients in a stressful setting?

title: ED Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It is a lot g process, everything about you is examined and looked at with a fine tooth comb. Your skills must be up to date. You are taught third way and you do everything thier way. Every job has to be verified and positive responses, references are a must and they are called and sent a letter with question to answer about you.
Interview Questions: How do you provide care to an upset patient and family?

title: Nurse Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Meet with Human Resources then departmental manager, complete a background check, drug testing. Process took about 3 weeks prior to onboarding. Orientation lasted about 2 weeks, then floor orientation roughly about 8 weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Full-time Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: The hiring managers were very welcoming and made the interviewee comfortable. The interview was thorough as I expected it to be and was more casual than formal. I have always appreciated interviews that were more conversational than structured back to back questions. So, overall this interview process for Wellstar was impressive. I was even asked to come back for a second interview to meet staff members, which I had never had happen before.
Interview Questions: Interviewers expressed a lot of interest in my previous work experiences on my resume pertaining to relevant populations.

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Applied on-line, called for an interview a couple days later. Met with manager and director. Very casual and relaxed interview. After the interview was given a tour of the area and introduced to employees and department.
Interview Questions: Situational questions, "How do you handle difficult employees ". Most questions were background based.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: This was a group interview, allowing staff members of all levels to come in and ask various questions. Enjoyed this type of interview. I this was a great approach to put the candidate at ease, however, I think some people would be intimidated by this process.
Interview Questions: All types of questions regarding experience, body mechanics, school, work ethics.

title: Clinical Care Partner Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Great relaxed environment. The unit staff really cared about who was going to get the position and truly wanted someone to be a part of their little family. I appreciated how relaxed the environment was. They knew that interviews were stressful and made it more like a conversation than a questionarre. It was odd how HR didn't sit in, just introduced and left.
Interview Questions: Name a difficult situation where you have given excellent care.

title: Nutrition Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Hiram, GA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with 3 management members. Very nice. Easy questions. Didn't even ask for food temps just basics. Cutting. Favorite food to prepare. How-to prepare. Ingredients. Are you in school? Reliable transportation? Describe a hard scenario and how well you responded? Just keep eye contact!
Interview Questions: Why do you feel your a great candidate for the position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was a new grad and it was a panel of managers.  Overall the situation was not as stressful as I expected.  Everyone was very nice and they wanted you to succeed
Interview Questions: A difficult situation with a patient and how did you deal with it?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, they called mi interview on phone then one on one.questions were good. I was interviewed by two people at same time each one asking questions back to back.
Interview Questions: If a patient fall, what the first thing u do?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: VERY slow process in that it took 5 months from the time that I applied until the time I learned that they were going to look for more candidates. Interviewed in person on two separate occasions with a total of 15-16 people. I really liked the organization but felt like they really didn't know what they wanted. Overall great experience as they seemed to be a great organization and very hospitable throughout the process.
Interview Questions: What's a perception that people have of you that isn't accurate, and why?

title: Information Security Team Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Specific questions, explanation of position and expectations, laid back atmosphere. The interview was 2:1. They asked very specific questions about items on my resume. They allowed plenty of time at the end of the interview for me to ask the questions I had prepared. I was very comfortable during the interview; it was not a stressful experience.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience with performing risk assessments.

title: Registered Nurse (RN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed before a panel, panel consisted of managers from department of several different hospital locations; included a multitude of questions, personality, situational, clinical, past experiences; allowed time for questions and/or concerns from potential employee; very pleasant attitude, positive experience
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Wellstar?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and I heard from the manager about 5 days later. I was asked to come in for an interview with him. I was sent a pre-interview reference check and background check. He was very laid back. I interviewed with him and then was sent to another office to interview with 4 employees in sets of two. After the interview I was given a tour of the pharmacy and was informed that I would hear from him in about 2 business days.
Interview Questions: How well do you handle conflict? What are your strengths and weaknesses? What do you want to know about the organization? What type of experience do you have? How flexible are you?

title: CCP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (North Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online from the wellstar website. After a couple of months I was then called and asked a few questions.  A couple of weeks later I was called again and asked to go to the location for a face to face interview. Preparing for an interview is always nerve racking no matter how prepared you are. Just be confident and positive. Let them know what you have to offer and what you can contribute to the company.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job

title: Registered Nurse (RN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Answer standard questions on-line then you will get called back by HR if you are picked for an interview.  Typically HR will walk you over to the unit to introduce you to the manager doing the interview.
Interview Questions:
Why you want to work at Wellstar
Why do you want to change jobs

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Looking forward to an interview with this company. Had few friends already did and they were very impressed. Very fair and professional. Their benefits package  and hours are also attractive
Interview Questions: What experience in the field do you have?

title: New RN Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and it took a week for someone to call me. A quick phone interview was done over the phone. The panel interview was scheduled a week later. The panel interview consisted of 3 managers from different floors. Each manager asked a question and they all took notes. I got a total of 5 questions. The managers were very nice. The interview lasted about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict with a coworker?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Hiram, GA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview went smooth.  Asked alot of questions just wanted to know how long it takes for them to contact you back if hired. But most of all they were very friendly and upfront about the company policies.
Interview Questions: How to deal with difficult co-workers and nmanagers?

title: Front Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed 3 times with the manager and several doctors.  All of the interviews were pleasant and appropriate.   Entire process took 30 days.  Process is extensive. Drug screen,  background check. Health assessment.   Now on to orientation.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work for Wellstar?

title: Senior Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Technical screen by third party consulting company, then face to face interview with hiring manager.  Fairly simple process that appears to be geared more toward getting a warm body in the door.  Tech screener asked pretty standard questions for the job role and spent much time promoting the benefits of working in the healthcare industry.  Hiring manager asked zero technical questions and concentrated on personality fit.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Met with nurse managers and  was asked to describe experiences as a nurse using the STAR approach. Was asked about my work history and my goals for the future. Interview lasted about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions:
Tell us about a time you had a conflict with coworker?
Tell us a time you made a difference in the life of a patient?
What does being a nurse mean to you?
Tell us about a time you made a mistake?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel of 6 women.  They all asked me varioud questions about my current and previous experience.   One lady was really stern,  but i didn't get caught off guard by it.  Overall I thought the interview went good.  But i didnt get the job.  This was my second interview with wellstar.   I don't know why it's so hard to get hired by them!
Interview Questions: Whst is one of your bad qualities

title: Front Office Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied through Wellstar's Career page. Took a while to receive a call back to interview. Inteviewed with several different offices. If you advance past the interview the next phase in hiring process is slow. There is not any communications as to status of progression on the website. You just have to wait and see. Overall the interviews went as to be expected.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Wellstar?

title: Front Office Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, interview was with manager and supervisor, contacted 3-4 days after interview from HR saying I've gotten the position, had to fill out references, background check, drug test, physical exam, orientation for two days.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with Epic? Computer literate? Education?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Went very well. Nice and short , but very informative. They gave me multiple options on interview times to work around my schedule. The commute btwn the interviewing location and the actual location for work was far, not sure why?
Interview Questions: How did I feel working with X population of people?

title: Assistant Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview by recruiter, followed by in-person interview. In-person interview with HR included briefing in benefits and brief review of background. Interview with potential supervisor briefly included background and went on to discuss management philosophy, expectations in first year, and upcoming structure changes.
Interview Questions: What is your management style?

title: Extern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Simple application but a long wait time to hear back. It was a 2 part interview first with an HR representative and the second was a  Panel interview. The HR interview was straight forward basic questions but the panel asked tricky but relevant questions.  HR is a little disorganized but friendly.  Overall a good experience but other hospitals offer more clarity throughout the process.  Well star is a heat place to work and offered me a good stepping stone for my career.
Interview Questions: List strengths and weaknesses.

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was one on one then group or panel interview. I did not find it too difficult. I also had a phone screen call before the one on one.I found the panel interview more taxing as they had multiple questions coming at me from different people . It did not seem very organized. I left feeling frustrated.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Lab Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Cobb, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: They  conducted  a very thorough background  check  on  both  criminal and  employment verification,  they  check  all  references thoroughly.  The  interview  was  very  easy  and  mostly  common  sense questions like  order of  draw and  how  to  correctly  enter  a room.  If  you  just  be  yourself  then it  isn't really a difficult process at all.
Interview Questions: How  do  you  handle  customer service with  a difficult patient?

title: Front Office Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions:
very long process, everyone friendly and pleasant, ask normal interview questions, smooth and laid back environment. nice manager and recruiters, I had 3 interviews then finally got an offer. the process is very long. they are very particular when screening their candidate,  very welcoming and h elpful and understanding.it. bruhhhhh ffffffffttt hovercraft#
pretty
Interview Questions: what are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Environmental Service Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line. Weeks later I was contacted by a recruiter. We had a phone interview. Two more weeks went by before I was contacted again. They invited me to do a face to face interview.
Interview Questions: In 3 to 5 years where do you see yourself?

title: Lab Support Specialist (Phlebotomist) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was formal and straight forward. The manager asked situational questions. Be prepared to explain previous examples of patient care/customer experience in great details. Explain each situation and how you handled it to resolve the issue.
Interview Questions: "Explain how you handle high stress situations and give one example of how you handled that situation in a fast past environment."

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: the interview was to the point and informative on duties and responsibilities. Also, what you can expect from them and also what they can expect from you. You have to pass the drug test, psychological exam and possess a current license to carry.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. I was told that I was hired because I was black. All I had to do was stick a patient.  The patient was so incoherent he he didn't even know that I wasn't an employee.
Interview Questions: What days do you want to work?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was called in for an interview,  asked the order of draw.  Had to  perform venipuncture on a current employee properly. Asked  how do I feel about team  work and employees you may not  get along with.  Met the current employees and were shown around the department. It was a fast interview.
Interview Questions: What is the order of draw

title: Manager and Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen quickly after applying, in person interview for one, no other contact after phone screen. Would be more professional if they acknowledged or provided closure to the process, instead of leaving you hanging out there not knowing if you were being considered or not.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Front Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application online and was called into the office to meet with the practice manager. She asked about my background and experience and what my future plans were. Nothing "situational" or standard cheesy interview questions. She called me about a week later and said they wanted to hire me. They had HR contact me to set up an official start date and orientation time.   Since HR was involved, it took a lot longer than some jobs, but that seems like the norm when corporations are involved. But it was nice to come into an interview and not be thrown a bunch of b.s. interview questions. It should just be a conversation between two people, not an interview to be the next Miss America.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult or unexpected.

title: Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Seated in a room with 30+ other applicants. We were called to individual tables to be interviewed. I was qualified for several positions so they kept shuffling me from person to person. I was not offered a job from that day, however, the recruiter called and left a message that another hiring manager wanted to speak with me. I returned the call more than once and never got a reply to set up the new interview..
Interview Questions: They asked if I thought I could keep up with the pace of the job.

title: Staffing Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Awkward. Questions were all over the place. Nothing about me as an individual just about how I would do the job. As a result there is a severe lack of cohesion among coworkers in the department.
Interview Questions: How do you have fun at work?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied mid May, first call back mid July; first interview end of July; notice of acceptance mid August. There were 8 people in my interview - all from different departments within PAS. They were real people and were all very friendly.
Interview Questions: What's the best example of customer service you have shown?

title: LIne Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: okay and not good as no real concern to find out about the candidate.  Management review was harsh and theyt seemed to care less and only wanted a body to meet criteria.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse (RN) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: It took 4 months to complete the process. HR was nice but very slow. The people that interviewed me were very nice, very professional. I  spoke with people working in the department and they seemed not to be a team and said the PTO was not so good or the health insurance which surprised me and was true when I looked into to it deeper. Although PTO accrues, you can't take any during the first 6 months. I was not planning on it but emergencies happen so it made me uncomfortable. I have seen where that's used to discipline people, read it here on the reviews. Also the new health insurance plan is just an Obama care plan they sell under Piedmont-Wellstar Health Plan. I read the fine print and was surprised about the high deductibles, copays and coverages if you don't get the premium plan, not sure if everyone qualifies to purchase it, didn't get that far. You do have to use their doctors it looked like, which I think would be fine unless you already have doctors somewhere else you want to keep using.
Interview Questions: Typical questions about your background, education, experience and such. Don't remember any unexpected questions for a nursing position.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application online, I did two working interviews which I didn't get paid for. I then waited for a month before I was finally offered a job. It took almost three months and they wouldn't tell me my salary until I was signing my contract.
Interview Questions: Would I be willing to travel?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: HR called for an interview a week after I applied online. She offered me the position at that time and we negotiated salary due to my work experience. They do an very extensive background check and reference check.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time that you had to deal with an extremely difficult patient..

title: OR Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: They're basically wasn't an interview with the manager, because you have to do an online personality assessment and a telephone interview with a HR representative. They'll give you at out while you're there and let you start whenever you like. The employees are very mean to new people. And they have a high turnover rate.
Interview Questions: Can you deal with difficult doctors?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a group of nurses. Intimidating to me.Second time on another unit. The manager who interviewed me was not the one who became the unit manager. That upset me.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your last position? I could have asked what happened to the manager who hired me?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Austell, GA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received invitation for F2F interview, email confirmation with request for additional information for previous employment verification, arrived at interview 30 min early, was ask to wait in hallway, when ask to join the interviewer there were 2 interviewers present, both ask situational type questions, and why I wanted to work for Wellstar. I found the interview to be a bit unprofessional as they would start to ask questions at the same time and then there was a you first, no you first type of situation. The interview lasted approximately 45 minutes to 1 hour. At the end of the interview I was told they would contact me after consulting each other and receiving verification from previous employers. I never received any contact and while I attempted to follow up I was only able to leave a message and still never heard back. It would have been considerate to at least send a TBNT email.
Interview Questions: These type of interviews always ask things like, How did you handle working with a coworker that didn't like you?

title: Front Office Coordinator/Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: All application are done online through WellStar.org.  It takes a very long time to hear back from someone.  Most people do not hear back within 6 months.  It is helpful to keep logging into your account and keep your resume as up to date as possible.  Once an HR representative contacts you regarding your position, you meet with a recruiter and possibly the manager you will be working under the same day.  If you are accepted, another meeting is scheduled to officially offer the position, the salary and benefit information.
Interview Questions: What is one instance of outstanding customer service that you have displayed? This is the most common question.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Received call with interview invitation email to follow. Went to live interview. Roundtable with multiple managers/educators. Received job offer the following day via phone, with email to follow.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director of Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call / screening about a week after I applied, and was then given a homework assignment that consisted of crisis communications exercises and a personality test. During the interview, they also wanted to know about high profile media placement.
Interview Questions: No unexpected questions.

title: Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was very sick and had a raspy voice, but through that, my interviewers could tell that I had the personality and experience for the job. They gave me a tour of the environment after the office interview. I was interviewed by the manager and supervisor. They were very polite and because my experience and availability aligned with their desires, I was an easy hire.
Interview Questions: How well would you say you are at customer service.

title: ICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was easy.  I enjoyed talking with my managers.  They asked appropriate questions.  I had an interview in front of 4 people that asked about my previous travels and experiences.  I was offered the job quickly.  I had to complete a lot of paperwork.
Interview Questions: A time when I had an issue with the doctor.

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a very basic interview questions, nothing special.  Had to present to verify that you could speak in front of a crowd.  In and out of the interview in under 10 minutes.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Probably one of the worse interviews I've ever been through. The hiring mgr flat talked me out of the position. Was saying stuff like I can only guarantee 3 months but there is a chance to go longer it all depends on you and other contractor's performance. Was in the middle of doing a DC migration and i asked how many PMOs were assigned he said none. That his team was "just doing it". Sorry i dont want to be part of a half assed data center move. He did not ask me any questions about myself or what I've done at previous jobs. This was a red flag to me. The environment seemed very hectic and employees faces seemed "less than thrilled" to be there. I told the recruiter I was no longer considering this position.
Interview Questions: They were all soft questions. Nothing technical. Which led me to believe they just wanted a warm body and didn't care who they got. This is not an environment that I can be successful in.

title: Medical Records Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had interview with Claudia. It took a hour interview with her. She did review my resume and cover letter that I gave it to her. I described my experience as working for medical field.
Interview Questions: Why did you wanted to be part of this team?

title: Clinical Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Onsite interview after online resume submission. You must pass the gallop assessment to be hired. You go to meet the HR recruiter. They give you a tour and you meet the interviewing manager. Some of the interviews were group interviews, while others were one on one. After the interview it takes about three weeks until orientation. The interview process was very easy and overall it was a good experience,
Interview Questions:
Describe a time you went above and beyond to provide the best quality care in a difficult situation?
What makes you the best candidate for the job?
How do you deal with family chaos?

title: Front Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and after four weeks, I was contacted by the recruiter. Since I was already in their system from previous positions that I applied, it was quick process. I was set an interview within a few days. On the day of interview I meet with the office manager. She went into the job listing, duties, and benefits offered with the company. It was a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Nothing was difficult, straight to the point what experiences I had previously.

title: Environmental Service Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Douglasville, GA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online got called back within two days interviewed..accepted offer. Had to email references so that they could describe the type of person I am. Had to do a drug test and got called to say I was hired
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable handling blood?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions:
I found the posting on wellstar.org. In addition to applying through the website, through a connection I had, I found the manager's name and e-mail and sent a personal, detailed e-mail of my personal history and why it was relevant in addition to my resume.

About 3 or 4 weeks later, I received a phone call from the manager, asking basic HR questions about my experience, what I expected from the job, etc. Over the phone, we scheduled an interview in person.

HR followed up with an e-mail and during the interview, I was interviewed by 6 people in different departments in a comfortable room with rocking chairs. Since the department emphasized women and children, the atmosphere was more about nurturing. We negotiated pay right on the spot and I went to orientation about 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions: You are overqualified for this position. Why would you want to take this?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Received first call from team supervisor to setup interview,then was interviewed by a day shift supervisor who asked basic interview questions relating to my resume,afterwards walked over to manager for final interview.
Interview Questions: what would you say is your weakness?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Windy Hill, GA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: We had a group interview, each took an individual written test. selection was based performance based. Followed by a 3 weeks paid training. Everything was medical base and nothing difficult since some of the questions offered multiple choices.
Interview Questions: tell us about yourself

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Austell, GA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was a quick phone interview.. be sure to speak on skills related to the position. Later there was a panel interview... ALL BEHAVIOR based.. be sure to give examples of relateable job experience.. last was a quick meeting with direct supervisor where I completed paperwork to start.
Interview Questions: name a time when you provided excellent customer service, name a time when you went over and beyond, name a time when you were asked to do something against your morals...

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very good, the manager at the time was very down to earth, didnt make me feel nervous, was interested in my interest if that makes sense.
Interview Questions: What do you look for in a manager?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straightforward..did a mini-phone interview with HR, then got a call back for a face to cafe. Met with HR and then the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: It wasn't a difficult interview at all, pretty standard "why do you want to work here", "tell me about your career" type questions

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: They called me and did a brief phone screening later called me back for a sit down interview with Human Resource. Then during the sit down interview the recruiter asked a few questions. A few days later she called me back to let me know that I have the job.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this particular hospital?

title: Radiology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System
Interview Descriptions: Long
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (New York, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was the same as every interview that any one has ever gone on before. so it was easy to see that the recruiter helped out with making it a easy set up for the job.
Interview Questions: have you worked in the health care field

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was an in person Panel interview with nurse manager and assistant nurse manager at the Hospital Unit conference center. It was casual and straight forward. This was following the Gallup Career Personality Assessment online.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time when you had to explain a complex issue to someone who knew very little about it. How did you make sure you got the point across? 

Describe a situation in which you handled a dissatisfied or difficult patient. Specifically, what did you do?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Have a strong knowledge of healthcare terminology. Do you research on the softwares, and equipment that are supported Flexible shift. Dress to impress as if you wanted the managers position. Be positive, on time, very confident, Honest and good references
Interview Questions: How did you react in an emergency 911 situation

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initially interviewed with HR recruiter. She asked typical "situational questions" Tell me about a time when.... Then met with the department manager, toured the floor and talked with staff which was extremely helpful.
Interview Questions: What would the most challenging adjustment coming on board

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Two interviews.  First interview a phone interview with HR, and the second with management.  Job offer extended a few days after second interview. 
Applied online.  Hard company to get on with.  Required to take a personality, psychological test upon applying.  Second interview was with management, and then taken around department to meet the staff, and have them ask you questions.  Easy interview if you have the knowledge and experience necessary.
Interview Questions: Asking about dosages and frequencies of medications that aren't required knowledge for this specific job.

title: IT Copr Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Communications about the job was slow and there were many delays.  Once the process started, it moved along.  The Org wasn't sure of my actual duties, that it would come later.
Interview Questions: Where do you want to be in 5 yrs.

title: Project Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very relaxing. The managers were very friendly and everyone had positive attitude.
Interview Questions: How did long did it takes for WellStar to adopt and adapt to the Change Board

title: Front Office Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with the recruiter, then face-to-face interview with department manager. After that you or may not have a second interview in front of a panel; depends on the department.  Pretty straight to the point.
Interview Questions: What is customer service to you?

title: Telecommunication Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Very down to earth. The group I interviewed with were very in touch with the industry and the latest and great technologies which made my interview earlier. The interview team was panel style and included basic question. They asked the questions you would expect to hear at an interview.
What do you know about the company.... Tell us about you... Past experiences.....
Interview Questions: What do you know about the company.... Tell us about you... Past experiences.....

title: IT Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: HR assessed almost 200 resumes and sent only 10 over to the hiring manager. HR initially did not want to offer the requested salary stating that they are a not-for-profit organization. The hiring manager, however, overrode HR so that they could draw better talent into their growing organization. Once on board, the entire first day is dedicated to orientation. The department I hired into did not have a formal on-boarding process, which made it quite difficult to understand who to go to for basic needs.
Interview Questions: Tell me why I should NOT hire you.

title: Patient Access Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Kennesaw, GA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with a panel first and then moved on instantly to a one on one interview with HR management.. it went backwards... However, I was asked general questions.. weaknesses, strengths, availability, past experience and to describe important assets like customer service, being on time and be ready to give examples in all your responses.
Interview Questions: Past experience

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process when I was hired was painless and easy.  It has changed since then with new management.  They also required a personality test to make sure that I was a good cultural fit, which was interesting.
Interview Questions: They asked about my experience.

title: Patient Access Services Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Austell, GA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions:
First a Phone interview with HR. Then a few days later another interview with HR, passed the screening, then across the street to a 1 hour interview with the PAS department hiring manager. The next day HR calls to schedule a week later, an eight panel member, 90 minute interview.  Four days later, “a walking tour of the facilities” with four of the panel members and the hiring manager. The HR person even sounded somewhat aghast that after three interviews including the eight person panel interview they would make you come back a third time for “a walking facility tour”. She said "she wants you to come in again!" Three days total investment which would be fine if you are not losing PTO time on your current job. 
Three weeks later, I still have no courtesy decline communication or answer. I have passed a government security clearance, so no background issues.  I feel it is extremely rude and inconsiderate for a candidate that invests this much time to receive no communication for a 32k a year position. If you just did a phone screen and got no decline letter, maybe that is acceptable.
I assume that this hiring manager for  routinely wastes  a lot of WellStar's time, her time and is extremely inconsiderate of a candidates time, gas, and the fact that you have to use vacation or personal time to come to 4 interviews. Not to promptly notify one of your status is extremely rude after making it down to the final two. How much time could it possibly take to extend this simple courtesy after a candidate willingly invests this much and the manager clearly has time to spare?
Interview Questions: Would you be upset if you spent a lot of time completeing a task then were told you needed to do it differently?

title: Manager, Service Excellence Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview started off positively with the actual team I would be working with.  By the time I was sent over to speak with the HR Manager and others (Interview #5) I was pretty worn out.  I just don't think it takes 5 interviews to figure out you won't hire.
Interview Questions: It was primarily target selection interview... typical

title: Health Place Exercise Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: UNPROFESSIONAL conduct within Wellstar Health Place both from the Director's Secy to the relisting of the position after the second interview without further communication.  I saw the position was relisted and it had been 2week since my interview, therefore wondered if my candidacy was no longer in the running. All I got was a reply that said THANK YOU. NICE JOB
Interview Questions: So you owned your own business?

title: Hospital Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions:
First off - if you think it is a good idea to apply to Wellstar online - think again. Even when qualified, the return reply is more often than not an automatic rejection. 

I applied online and was rejected last yr and then received an interview call a month later. They do not follow protocol in the contact method and HR does not care about your concerns that they do not follow protocol in the hiring process. The person running the HR hiring dept responded to an email I wrote in an unprofessional manner. I had called  (she was never available and did not return calls) asking about interview follow through post-interview and correct chain in the hiring process. No one has job security these days including HR hiring managers. It is incredible to have such a sloppy hiring system combined with unprofessional email transmissions.

Try to apply online? Get used to the categorical rejection without so much as an call. But they list and relist these jobs almost weekly. Either they cannot retain those hired or they need to meet regulations  on listing.

They do NOT care how qualified you are. 

Another student in my school recounted a similar no follow through interview. She was interviewed by several of would be co workers and never heard back from the hiring interviewer. If you get an interview (rare) then be prepared to be set before a group of peers who get to decide if you are hired or not. No previous review of your resume. They are all called in to evaluate if they like you or not and have no previous experience hiring employees. They simply indicate their opinion of your personality.

VERY professional!  Laughable.
Interview Questions: What do you want out of life?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Wellstar Health System (Marietta, GA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring manager was very personable and took an interest in my story.  She asked questions and probed but also provided information about herself.  She was candid and asked direct questions.  As nursing interviews go, this one was about as straightforward as is typical of the profession.  The recruiter 
wants to understand that your skill sets will match up with the unit you are assigned.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were tricky or out of the ordinary.  The recruiter did want to know how I would adapt to a float pool position, as it requires flexibility and a willingness to work in many different environments within the hospital.
